question: Is it bad to ignore what makes you upset?
question_content: I literally never think about my past. In life, i do something and move on, whether im happy about it or not. There are alot of things I could be sad about but I'm not. Whenever one of my memories comes into my head I get a quick gut wrenching feeling and then I force myself to think of something else. Like ill take a few xanax or ill call someone to come pick me up. It works but at the same time I feel a little numb emotionally. What is the best way to deal with what makes you upset?

answers.answer_content: It depends on the subject. Ignore that which is harmful to your body, mind or soul. Otherwise retain. Forget bad past is the rule. That remembrances, which can strengthen your spirit can be retained in memory. Mental health is an important and intricate subject. Hence, it is better to discuss this issue with a professionally qualified doctor.

What you are doing is short term.  You have to take some time and really think about things.  Journal instead when you think of something upsetting. Don't keep it in.   Listen to music and relate your experiences to the songs. Google what is upsetting you and read about people who went through the same thing.  It helps.  If you don't face it, it will come back an haunt you in ways you never thought.  Like the type of parent you become.  How you are in relationships, whether you get an addiction problem.  The earlier you deal with it, the better.

bad?  you should be really happy that you are able to ignore bad things that bothers you and the bad stuff that had hapened before , you are suppose to delete bad memmories. i honestly wish i could do that , thats why i take medicine to help me sleep because i think about things that puts me in a bad mood , i cant get over the past and i hate it its so not healthy and it causes me alot of stress and depression i just wish i could forget all about it and live my life but its hard for me . the reason why im telling you this isnt because i like to put my business out there but to make you understand how big and good it is to be able to ignore the past and just move on with your life.

I like to sit down and think through what happened. I try to come to an opinion about what happened, and if I don't like it, I try to figure out how I can avoid doing the same type of thing again. Then I move on.
Yes because the more you ignore why your upset it will just add up and sooner or later you will end up deeply depressed its good to vent things out to someone
My personal opinion is yes. I once have done that and I had a panic attack from being to depressed.
It's good to vent and to find a way, a good way, to feel better.
